intro: Heriteria anthericoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray flowers. Heriteria anthericoides is often found in fynbos vegetation and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region.
